title: 103_hr1294
content: Designation of military installations and certain communities as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas. Designation of military installations selected for closure or realignment as enterprise zones by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development for redevelopment purposes. The Secretary of Commerce designates military installations selected for closure or realignment as redevelopment areas, including the local community within the administrative and political jurisdiction of the installation. The Secretary of Commerce designates military installations recommended for closure or realignment as redevelopment areas within 60 days of the base closure report being transmitted to Congress. The Secretary of Commerce designates military installations for closure or realignment within 60 days of the base closure report being transmitted to Congress, as required by the Defense Base Closure and Realignment Act of 1990. The Act requires the Secretary of Commerce to designate military installations for closure or realignment within 60 days of the base closure report being transmitted to Congress. Enterprise zones designated under the Act are in addition to the 100 zones authorized under the Housing and Community Development Act of 1987. Enterprise zones designated under the Housing and Community Development Act of 1987 may receive funding for economic adjustment or community planning from programs administered by the Secretary of Defense or Commerce in connection with military base closures. The designation of a military installation as a redevelopment area under subsection (b) shall remain in effect for a 5-year period. The Secretary of Commerce will conduct an annual review of the area and terminate or modify the designation if it does not meet the requirements. The Secretary of Commerce conducts annual reviews of military installation redevelopment areas under the Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965. The designation can be terminated or modified if it fails to meet the requirements. The term "base closure law" refers to specific legislation related to base closures and realignment. The term "substantial realignment" refers to a significant reduction in the operation of a military installation where 50 percent or more of personnel are reassigned to another military base. This definition is outlined in specific legislation related to base closures and realignment. Priority for commercial use of property on military installations designated as enterprise zones and redevelopment areas is emphasized. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to restrict the use of military installation properties for homeless assistance until certain certifications are made to Congress. The Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act is amended to require certifications to Congress before military installation properties can be used for homeless assistance.
